heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike recorded happened on 13 May 2025 and was just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: The last storm was on 14 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (194°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the outside temperature (up 2.0°C) and feels like temperature (up 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 195 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 993 m), feels like temperature (up 4.4°C), outside temperature (up 2.8°C), and inside temperature (up 3.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 195.1m higher than yesterday, 416.4m lower than the past week, 993.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 557m minimum and 1248m maximum, with an average of 1140.9m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1557.2m and 2130m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and the light is absent. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
